summary: This Presidential Memorandum focuses on reforming accountability measures for Career Senior Executive Service (SES) officials. The memo asserts the President's constitutional authority over executive branch employees and establishes new requirements for managing SES officials. It directs agencies to implement specific changes within 30 days, including adopting new performance plans, reconstituting Executive Resources Boards with more political appointees, revising Performance Review Board membership, and taking immediate action against underperforming SES officials. The memo emphasizes the President's removal power as essential to ensuring faithful execution of laws and policies.
eli5: The President wants to make sure the important people who help run the government are doing their jobs properly. If they don't follow rules or do their work well, the President wants to be able to replace them with people who will.
issues: The memo could significantly reduce career civil service protections for SES officials
The changes may lead to increased political influence over traditionally non-partisan career positions
The broad definition of unsatisfactory performance could be used to remove officials for political reasons
The 30-day implementation timeline may be unrealistically short for such significant changes
The memo may conflict with existing civil service laws and protections
citations: Seila Law LLC v. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, 591 U.S. 197 (2020)
